title: Get Started
text: install package Github: use package installed: Make sure packages installed well:

title: Get Started
text: package simulates estimates class panel regression models following form: \[ y_{} = x_{}'\beta + w_{}'\gamma + \epsilon_{} + \nu_{}, \] data described follows: \(\) indexes cross-sectional unit; \(t\) indexes time period; \(y_{}\) outcome interest; \(x_{}\) vector endogenous regressors; , \(w_{}\) vector exogenous regressors goal estimate \(\beta\), \(\gamma\) treated nuisance parameter. three unobservable processes: \(\epsilon_{}\) error term upon \(x_{}\) depends. independent \(w_{}\); \(\nu_{}\) serially-independent shock independent \(x_{}, x_{-1},...\) \(w_{}, w_{-1},...\); , \(\eta_{}\) another serially-independent shock independent \(x_{-1},x_{-2},...\) \(w_{}, w_{-1},...\) “model” refers assumed time-series process governing \(\epsilon_{}\): Fixed Effects (“FE”): \(\epsilon_{} = \bar\epsilon_i, \forall t\). Serially Independent (“iid”): \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{}\). Moving Average Order 1 (“MA1”): \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{} + \theta \eta_{-1}\). First Order Autoregressive (“AR1”): \(\epsilon_{} = \rho \epsilon_{-1} + \eta_{}\). estimators assume number time periods small sample size large (“small-T big-N” asymptotics).

title: Get Started
text: package contains two functions: PanelRegSim: Simulate panel data according model specification. PanelReg: Estimate \(\beta\) given assumed model. order use PanelReg, must first define variable names. variable names : id_name: name variable indexes cross-sectional unit. time_name: name variable indexes time period. outcome_name: name outcome variable. endogenous_names: vector names endogenous regressors. covariate_names: vector names covariates controlled linearly. argument optional. fixedeffect_names: vector names covariates controlled forming discrete group indicators estimating fixed-effects. Optional. following code block defines variable names examples :
code: varnames = list(   id_name = "unit_id",   time_name = "time_id",   outcome_name = "outcome",   endogenous_names = c("endog_var1", "endog_var2"),   covariate_names = NULL,   fixedeffect_names = NULL )

title: Get Started
text:
error term given \(\epsilon_{} =  ar\epsilon_i,  orall t\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: first-difference model , \[ y_{} - y_{-1} = (x_{} - x_{-1})' eta + (w_{} - w_{-1})'\gamma + (
u_{} - 
u_{-1}), \] Since unobservable differenced equation, \(
u_{} - 
u_{-1}\), independent regressors, \( eta\) can estimated without instrument. implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "FE", seed = 123, sample_size = 30000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2)) head(simulated_data) #>    unit_id time_id    outcome  endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>      <num>       <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -0.8228488  1.37372079  1.6182365 #> 2:       1    2004 -0.1980669  0.78648723  1.8334282 #> 3:       1    2005 -1.7076139  0.91339025  0.1406808 #> 4:       1    2006  1.7022338  2.69872982 -1.6701665 #> 5:       2    2003 -0.1153945  0.77062825  2.2354685 #> 6:       2    2004 -0.6152379 -0.01385007  2.7283228 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.586300 0.002338 250.81435      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.160455 0.002310 -69.47316      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "FE", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.498134 0.004735 105.20119      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.193313 0.003940 -49.06571      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{}\). model can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: contemporaneous \(x_{}\) depends \(\eta_{}\), lag \(x_{-1}\) independent \(\eta_{}\). Since \(x_{-1}\) valid instrument, can estimate \(\beta\) regressing \(y_{}\) \(x_{}\), instrumented \(x_{-1}\), controlling \(w_{}\). implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "iid", seed = 123, sample_size = 30000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2)) head(simulated_data) #>    unit_id time_id   outcome endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>     <num>      <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -3.113270 -2.7313346  2.4799346 #> 2:       1    2004  1.368982  1.8261756  4.0147715 #> 3:       1    2005 -1.395690  0.1037291  5.1806331 #> 4:       1    2006  0.133951 -0.4967244  4.3168586 #> 5:       2    2003  1.844357  0.9276361 -0.7587949 #> 6:       2    2004  1.074739  0.5249783  1.2733139 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE   tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>    <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.582662 0.002346 248.3678      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.162887 0.002317 -70.2975      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "iid", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.498475 0.002894 172.25028      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.201062 0.002931 -68.60669      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \eta_{} + \theta \eta_{-1}\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: Estimating model “iid” model, biased estimates follows: Similarly “iid” case, can use lagged values \(x\) valid instruments contemporaneous \(x\). Since \(\epsilon\) serially dependent adjacent periods (\(\epsilon_{}\) correlated \(\epsilon_{-1}\) uncorrelated \(\epsilon_{-2}\)), non-adjacent lags \(x\) valid instruments. implementation thus uses \(x_{-2}\) instrument. implementation follows:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "MA1", seed = 123, sample_size = 30000,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2006, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2)) head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id, time_id> #>    unit_id time_id     outcome  endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>       <num>       <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -2.49082896 -2.47198438  2.6096097 #> 2:       1    2004  0.25097599  1.36033970  3.7818535 #> 3:       1    2005 -1.58427970  0.02514993  5.1413435 #> 4:       1    2006  0.09012397 -0.51498567  4.3077280 #> 5:       2    2003  1.73926560  0.88384807 -0.7806889 #> 6:       2    2004  1.19559529  0.57533497  1.2984922 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.602865 0.002460 245.06719      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.154156 0.002441 -63.16154      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "iid", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.553695 0.002959 187.13657      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.175005 0.003046 -57.44913      0 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.498406 0.003562 139.91227      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.203401 0.003599 -56.51953      0

title: Get Started
text: error term given \(\epsilon_{} = \rho\epsilon_{-1} + \eta_{}\). data can simulated follows: Ignoring endogeneity, biased estimates follows: package provides three strategies estimating AR(1) model: Panel IV GMM. Panel IV: error structure implies , \[ y_{} = \rho y_{-1} + x_{}'\beta +  x_{-1}'(-\beta\rho) +  w_{}'\gamma + w_{-1}'(-\gamma\rho) + \eta_{}\] Since \(x_{}\) depends unobservable \(\eta_{}\), lagged values \(x\) independent contemporaneous \(\eta\), follows \(\beta\) can estimated regression \(y_{}\) \(x_{}\), instrument \(x_{-2}\), controlling \((y_{-1}, x_{-1}, w_{}, w_{-1})\). Another available instrument \(y_{-2}\), option use lagged outcome IV well. GMM: error structure implies , guess \((\beta,\gamma,\rho)\), can construct implied \(\eta\): \[\hat\eta(\beta,\gamma,\rho) \equiv (y_{} - \rho y_{-1}) - (x_{} - \rho x_{-1})'\beta - (w_{} - \rho w_{-1})'\gamma\] GMM approach uses , true values parameters, following vector moments hold: \[\mathbb{E}[(x_{-1},x_{-2},w_{}) \hat\eta(\beta,\gamma,\rho) ] = \vec{0}\] Similar moments hold respect lagged values outcome, \(y_{-1}\) \(y_{-2}\) implementation follows: Implementations: Estimating AR(1) model first requires defining AR1_options, list options estimation. options : AR1_method: estimation method use. options “PanelIV” “GMM”. required. AR1_IV_outcome: logical indicating whether lagged outcome used instrument. required. AR1_IV_lags: number lags outcome use instruments. required AR1_method = “GMM”. However, always 2 AR1_method = “PanelIV”. PanelIV implementation including lagged outcomes IVs: GMM implementation, using 2 lags including lagged outcomes IVs: Note estimate AR(1) persistence parameter, \(\rho\), returned “AR1” implementations.
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "AR1", seed = 123, sample_size = 100000, noise_sd = 0,                               min_year = 2003, max_year = 2008, true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2)) head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id> #>    unit_id time_id   outcome endog_var1 endog_var2 #>      <int>   <int>     <num>      <num>      <num> #> 1:       1    2003 1.7044560  0.8174206 -0.3049707 #> 2:       1    2004 1.8042772  0.4239283 -2.7399114 #> 3:       1    2005 2.6948339  0.3930798 -1.9066454 #> 4:       1    2006 2.5315088  0.2970987 -2.8123841 #> 5:       1    2007 0.6633786 -0.9285368 -1.4109476 #> 6:       1    2008 3.5206791  1.5559909 -2.7314650 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "exogenous", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.591082 0.000669  884.1034      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.156579 0.000664 -235.8358      0 AR1_options = list(   AR1_method = "PanelIV",   AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE )  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "AR1",                 varnames = varnames, AR1_options = AR1_options) head(reg) #>           Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>             <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1:      endog_var1  0.510151 0.008986  56.77468      0 #> 2:      endog_var2 -0.201861 0.004943 -40.84094      0 #> 3: AR1_persistence  0.502415 0.002533 198.32126      0 AR1_options = list(   AR1_method = "GMM",   AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE,   AR1_IV_lags = 2 )  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "AR1",                 varnames = varnames, AR1_options = AR1_options) #> [1] "Best initial guess of beta parameters: 0.499, -0.202. Best initial guess of AR1 persistence: 0.5." head(reg) #> Key: <Variable> #>           Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>             <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: AR1_persistence  0.499734 0.001989  251.2433      0 #> 2:      endog_var1  0.498629 0.000776  642.7568      0 #> 3:      endog_var2 -0.201722 0.001607 -125.5449      0

title: Get Started
text: Consider “MA1” model. can add covariates simulated model setting true_gamma parameter: control covariates, estimation becomes biased: control linearly covariates, add names varnames list $covariate_names argument:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "MA1", seed = 123, sample_size = 50000,                               noise_sd = 0, min_year = 2003, max_year = 2009,                               true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2), true_gamma = c(1, -1))  head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id, time_id> #>    unit_id time_id    outcome endog_var1 endog_var2   co_var1 #>      <int>   <int>      <num>      <num>      <num>     <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -2.0605249  3.5229630   1.755736 4.8656474 #> 2:       1    2004  2.0006128  1.8319548   2.045503 0.4553866 #> 3:       1    2005 -1.6772393  0.7925879   3.133644 3.1441974 #> 4:       1    2006 -0.8613785  0.4009817   2.363604 1.0405139 #> 5:       1    2007 -2.7933449  1.0296613   3.076621 3.2732190 #> 6:       1    2008 -0.8734858 -1.7808037   0.353517 0.7459363 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.200977 0.001404  143.1672      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.199640 0.001433 -139.2855      0 varnames$covariate_names = c("co_var1")  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.444320 0.001555  285.7827      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.199226 0.001083 -183.9064      0  varnames$covariate_names = NULL

title: Get Started
text: Consider “iid” model. can assign units groups simulated model setting true_FE_var parameter. variance positive, unit ID assigned group, group--time shock drawn. control group identifiers, estimation becomes biased group fixed-effects: control group fixed-effects, add names varnames list $fixedeffect_names argument. Note need first define group--time identifier:
code: simulated_data = PanelRegSim(panel_model = "MA1", seed = 123, sample_size = 50000,                               noise_sd = 0, min_year = 2003, max_year = 2008,                               true_beta = c(0.5, -0.2), true_FE_var = 5) head(simulated_data) #> Key: <unit_id, time_id> #>    unit_id time_id    outcome endog_var1  endog_var2 group_id #>      <int>   <int>      <num>      <num>       <num>    <num> #> 1:       1    2003 -0.6759059 -1.4776150  2.74665459        9 #> 2:       1    2004  3.1271867  0.7580309  0.16579571        9 #> 3:       1    2005  2.4725628  0.7254557  1.64476686        9 #> 4:       1    2006 -0.6233063 -1.9101949 -0.03007159        9 #> 5:       1    2007 -0.3409877 -2.0354230 -1.26717286        9 #> 6:       1    2008  1.1957164  1.2641465  1.11148877        9 reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.309975 0.003971  78.06465      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.197557 0.002135 -92.55340      0 simulated_data[, group_year := .GRP, by = c("group_id", "time_id")] varnames$fixedeffect_names = "group_year"  reg = PanelReg(panel_data = simulated_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames = varnames) head(reg) #>      Variable  Estimate       SE    tvalue pvalue #>        <char>     <num>    <num>     <num>  <num> #> 1: endog_var1  0.500840 0.001245  402.3705      0 #> 2: endog_var2 -0.200474 0.001261 -159.0098      0  varnames$fixedeffect_names = NULL

code: @Manual{,   title = {PanelReg: Estimate Panel Regression Models},   author = {Bradley Setzler},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://setzler.github.io/PanelReg/}, }

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: package simulates estimates class panel regression models form, yit = xit′β + wit′γ + ϵit + νit. parameter interest β, xit vector endogenous regressors, wit vector exogenous covariates, ϵit endogenous unobservable, νit exogenous unobservable (.e. measurement error). purpose package provide convenient estimator β given common time-series process assumptions ϵit, : Fixed Effects (“FE”): ϵit = ϵ̄, ∀t. Serially Independent (“iid”): ϵit = ηit. Moving Average Order 1 (“MA1”): ϵit = ηit + θηit − 1. First Order Autoregressive (“AR1”): ϵit = ρϵit − 1 + ηit. 2 functions package: PanelReg(): function estimates panel regression model. Documentation available running ?PanelReg R. PanelRegSim(): function simulates data panel regression model. Documentation available running ?PanelRegSim R.

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: estimation, set variable list names variables: estimate panel regression, syntax follows: argument panel_model must one "exogenous", "FE", "iid", "MA1", "AR1". complete examples details estimators simulators, see Get Started page.
code: varnames = list(   id_name = "ID",   time_name = "Year",   outcome_name = "Y",   endogenous_names = c("X1", "X2"),   covariate_names = c("W1"),   fixedeffect_names = c("Group") ) reg = PanelReg(panel_data, panel_model = "MA1", varnames)

title: Estimate Panel Regression Models
text: install package Github: use package installed: Make sure packages installed well:

what: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: function estimates panel regression model.

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
code: PanelReg(   panel_data,   panel_model,   varnames,   AR1_options = list(AR1_method = "PanelIV", AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE) )

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: panel_data (data.table) data.table containing panel data. "long" format, means row uniquely identified (id, time) combination. panel_model (character) panel model estimate. Must one "exogenous", "iid", "FE", "MA1", "AR1". See package vignette details. varnames (list) list containing names variables panel_data. must contain following elements: id_name, time_name, outcome_name, endogenous_names. Optionally, also contains covariate_names fixedeffect_names. id_name time_name names unit time variables, respectively. outcome_name name outcome variable. endogenous_names character vector names endogenous variables. covariate_names character vector names covariates control linearly, fixedeffect_names character vector names covariates control using discrete indicators. covariate_names NULL, model estimated without linear covariates. fixedeffect_names NULL, model estimated without fixed effects. AR1_options (list) panel_model != "AR1", list ignored. panel_model = "AR1", list must non-empty. contains options estimating AR(1) model. must contain following elements: AR1_method, AR1_IV_lags, AR1_IV_outcome, AR1_persistence. AR1_method method use estimate AR(1) model, must one "PanelIV" "GMM". AR1_IV_lags number lags use IV regression, must 1 2, used AR1_method = "GMM". AR1_IV_outcome specifies whether include lagged outcome variable instrument. particular lags outcome used inferred AR1_IV_lags. AR1_persistence value force AR(1) persistence parameter equal; NULL, AR(1) persistence parameter estimated. default AR1_options = list(AR1_method = "PanelIV", AR1_IV_outcome = TRUE).

title: Estimate a panel regression model — PanelReg
text: (data.table) estimates panel regression model.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: function simulates panel dataset given number units time periods. user can specify distribution error term, number units, number time periods, parameters model. function returns panel dataset form data.table.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
code: PanelRegSim(   seed = 1234,   sample_size = 10000,   min_year = 2000,   max_year = 2010,   noise_sd = 1,   panel_model = "iid",   true_beta = 0.5,   endog_weight = 0.5,   MA1_persistence = 0.5,   AR1_persistence = 0.5,   true_gamma = c(1),   true_FE_var = 0,   return_unobservables = FALSE )

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: seed (integer) seed random number generator. sample_size (integer) number units panel dataset. min_year (integer) first year panel dataset. max_year (integer) last year panel dataset. noise_sd (numeric) standard deviation measurement error. panel_model (character) panel model use. Options "iid", "FE", "AR1", "MA1". true_beta (numeric) true value parameter interest. endog_weight (numeric) weight endogenous variable panel model. Must 0 1. MA1_persistence (numeric) persistence parameter MA(1) process, .e., eps_it = shock_it + MA1_persistence * shock_it-1. AR1_persistence (numeric) persistence parameter AR(1) process, .e., eps_it = AR1_persistence * eps_it-1 + shock_it. true_gamma (numeric) true value parameter exogenous variables. first entry corresponds intercept. default, true_gamma = c(1).length(gamma) > 1, function adds exogenous variables outcome correlated first endogenous variable. true_FE_var (numeric) variance fixed effects. default, true_FE_var = 0 fixed effects. true_FE_var > 0, function adds fixed effects outcome correlated first endogenous variable. return_unobservables (logical) TRUE, function returns full panel dataset, including unobservable variables. FALSE, function returns observable variables.

title: Simulate a panel dataset. — PanelRegSim
text: (data.table) panel dataset.
